paragraph.heading:
5.
Rhamnus kurdica Boiss. & Hohen.
in Boissier (1843: 3).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Typus
â€” IRAQ . Mosul : In rupestribus septentrionem versus setis in cacumen Chiya-e Gara ,
Kotschy 336
( H )
.

Description â€”Shrubs erect and spreading on rocks, 30â€“200 cm high. Stems grey, greyish brown; with low to medium dense spines. Spines simple and rarely branched, 0.5â€“8 cm long, grey or brown, greyish brown and red (when young), alternate and rarely opposite, with grey long lines. Branches with few spines, two types of branches: long branches pubescent, low to medium density, mainly alternate and rarely opposite, the angles between branches acute, straight, rarely obtuse; rarely with parallel branches; short (scaly) branches bearing flowers, fruits or fasciculate leaves at the end. Leaves 5â€“30 Ã— 3â€“12 mm , pubescent, herbaceous to membraneus, thin (thicker in fruiting plants), dimorphic (elliptic, obovoid) and rarely cordate in each specimen, alternate or fasciculate on short branches, silver green and rarely green, medium density; base of leaves cuneate or rounded; apex of leaves mostly obtuse and rarely acute; with 6â€“11 pairs of teeth at the margin (rarely 2â€“6) pairs or absent; gland teeth present or absent; lateral nerves 3â€“6 pairs, conspicuous, curved or straight; lateral nerves and main vein green in flowering and cream to brown in maturing fruits, alternate or opposite; petioles sometimes pubescent, unequal in each node, 2â€“6(â€“10) mm long and mostly smaller than peduncles. Inflorescence fasciculate. Flowers bisexual and rarely with sterile female flowers, 2â€“3 mm long, in leaves axis; calyx campanulate, without gland, 3 mm long; lobes 2 mm long, acute; petals linear, 2 mm , opposite to filaments; disk very small; ovary with 2â€“3(â€“4) locular and with 2â€“3(â€“4) styls; peduncles unequal in each node, 2-8 mm long, equaling, longer or rarely shorter than the petioles. Fruits a fleshy spherical drupe, 3-4 mm long, mature fruits bright red, immature green or yellow, with 2â€“3(â€“4) seeds, with not fully developed seed and with 2â€“3(â€“4) deep and rarely closed furrows. Sseeds 3 mm long, with one split.

Habitat and distribution â€”
Endemic in IRAN and TURKEY . It is an Irano-Turanian element in W Iran at an altitude of
1000â€“1600 m
, between 40Â° and 46Â° E and between 34Â° and 37Â° N , on E slopes of rocks and rarely cliffs
.
Phenology â€”Flowering is in late May, fruits and seeds maturie in September.
